supply_logistics.supply_status: Strained. Division dependent on extended supply lines from Tripoli (approximately 1,600km). Water supply critical in desert environment. Limited motorization (60 trucks) restricts mobility and supply capacity. Fuel and ammunition subject to Allied interdiction of Mediterranean shipping.

equipment.note: 3 Battalions (3 batteries of 75/18 howitzers each), 1 Battalion (3 batteries of 20mm AA guns)

tactical_doctrine.role: Binary infantry division for defensive operations in North Africa. Typical Italian colonial-type division with reduced motorization and limited offensive capability. Designed for static defense and line-holding duties.
known_issues: Critical shortage of vehicles (60 trucks vs. theoretical 800+)
Limited anti-tank capability (47/32 guns inadequate vs. British armor)
Water supply constraints in desert operations
Dependency on horse transport (528 horses) limits tactical mobility
No organic armor or motorized reconnaissance
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Tropical uniforms (sahariana), reduced water rations, reliance on desert supply routes, modified tactical doctrine for open terrain

special_rules: Limited mobility: half movement rate for non-motorized elements
Supply vulnerability: check supply status every 3 turns
Heat exhaustion: -1 to all actions in temperatures >35째C
AT gun ineffectiveness: 47/32 guns -2 penetration vs. medium/heavy armor

source: Nafziger Collection: 942IFBA - 1st Superga Division, North Africa, 15 June 1942
National Archives Microcopy No. T-821, Roll 144
TME 30-420 Handbook on Italian Military Forces, August 1943
Order of Battle of the Italian Army, US G-2, July 1943

command.commander.name.reason: Commander name not present in Nafziger source document (942IFBA). Italian divisional commanders for June 1942 require additional archival research.
sources_checked: Order of Battle of Italian Army G-2 1943 (post-Tunisia, not applicable)
command.commander.name.mitigation: Research Italian official histories (Stato Maggiore) or Comando Supremo records for June 1942 North Africa command assignments

command.headquarters_location.reason: Source only states 'North Africa' without specific location. June 1942 operational records needed.
command.headquarters_location.mitigation: Cross-reference with Panzerarmee Afrika war diaries and Italian XX Corps records

ncos.reason: Nafziger source provides 'officers' and 'troops' but does not break out NCO count separately. Italian divisions typically had 8-10% NCO ratio.
ncos.estimate_method: Could estimate ~370-465 NCOs based on 8-10% of 4,648 total, but not included without source confirmation

horses_total_and_allocation.reason: Source shows horses for 91st Regiment (128) and 92nd Regiment (400) = 528 total, but artillery regiment and division HQ horse allocation not specified
horses_total_and_allocation.estimate_method: Italian artillery regiments typically had 200-300 horses, division HQ ~50-80

equipment_witw_ids.reason: WITW equipment database matching is Phase 5 work (currently paused). Italian equipment IDs not yet mapped.
equipment_witw_ids.mitigation: Complete Phase 5 equipment matching for Italian weapons/vehicles
